ivory.h1: Ivory Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
ivory.title: Ivory Travertine Slabs
ivory.intro: Ivory Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs deliver a refined, contemporary look with consistent linear veining and a smooth, low‑gloss surface. The filled pores create a seamless feel ideal for high‑traffic interiors, while the honed finish reduces glare and highlights the stone’s warm beige tone. Sourced from leading Turkish quarries and processed to tight tolerances, these slabs are engineered for easy fabrication and color continuity across large areas. Majen supplies multiple thicknesses with export‑ready packaging and flexible logistics for global projects.
ivory.intro2: This finish and cut combination excels in residential and commercial spaces that demand both elegance and practicality. Indoors, slabs perform beautifully on floors, walls, bathrooms, and kitchen splashbacks, pairing well with metal, wood, and glass details. In hospitality and retail environments, the calm honed surface supports a premium ambience without visual noise. For covered exteriors, vein cut geometry delivers striking linear movement on façades and columns. Architects choose this specification to achieve modern lines, uniform color, and easy maintenance in daily use.
ivory.text3: TPricing is influenced by slab thickness, grade, and selection consistency. Common thicknesses include 2 cm and 3 cm, with custom options available for specialty applications. Standard slab formats support efficient nesting in fabrication and minimize waste for large flooring runs. Typical price ranges are USD 22–45 per m² for 2 cm and USD 32–58 per m² for 3 cm depending on tone, finish quality, and order volume. Majen provides transparent, itemized quotes that separate material, finishing, and logistics so procurement teams can compare scenarios precisely.
ivory.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Honed • Vein Cut
ivory.text4: Filled: micro‑pore cavities are filled for a smooth, hygienic surface suitable for bathrooms and kitchens. Honed: a matte, low‑reflection finish that emphasizes warmth and texture while resisting fingerprints and glare. Vein Cut: slicing parallel to the bedding creates directional, linear veining ideal for modern, continuous designs. Combined, these properties deliver a balanced surface with reliable slip behavior indoors and a uniform visual rhythm. For outdoor or wet zones, specify appropriate sealing and R‑rating according to local code and usage conditions.
ivory.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Filled vs Unfilled
ivory.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut yields linear movement and tonal stripes; cross cut reveals cloud‑like patterns and softer transitions. Choose vein cut for corridors and large runs where directionality guides the eye; choose cross cut for calmer, diffuse visuals. Filled vs Unfilled: Filled surfaces are smooth and easy to clean; unfilled maintains natural texture and additional traction. For wet indoor areas, filled + honed offers hygiene and maintenance advantages; for rustic or exterior looks, unfilled may suit better with proper sealing.

filled-polished.title2: What Is Filled Polished Vein Cut Travertine?
filled-polished.intro2: “Vein Cut” refers to slabs sliced parallel to the natural layers of stone, producing a linear, directional vein pattern. “Filled” slabs have natural voids sealed for strength and easy maintenance. “Polished” transforms the honed surface into a mirror-like finish with rich color depth. Together, these processes deliver elegant, smooth slabs that reflect light and enhance architectural refinement. Majen’s selection and finishing control guarantee a premium visual experience across all shipments.

Vein Cut: Linear slicing along the bedding direction produces graceful striations that guide visual flow and continuity. Together, these processes produce a radiant, durable surface suitable for luxury interiors that demand precision and elegance.
light.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Filled vs Unfilled
light.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut showcases elegant horizontal lines, perfect for directional design and optical balance; cross cut emphasizes softer, more organic patterns. TextSection.text1: The unfilled polished combination enhances the stone’s natural identity. Open pores maintain texture and originality, while the polished surface amplifies visual depth and light reflection. This duality creates luxurious contrast—authentic material character with a contemporary glossy finish. Majen’s precise polishing process achieves even gloss distribution without sealing the natural pores, maintaining breathability.
TextSection.text2: Unfilled Polished Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are perfect for feature walls, lobby accents, fireplaces, reception areas, and exclusive residences. seo.title: Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs – Quarry Supplier from Turkey | Majen
seo.description: Discover Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs with mirror gloss, filled structure, and continuous linear veins. Ivory, Light, and Antico colors available for worldwide export.

filled-brushed.h1: Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-brushed.title: Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-brushed.lead: Majen offers Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut parallel to the natural veins and carefully filled to enhance stability and durability. A subtle brushed texture highlights the natural vein movement while providing a soft, tactile surface with gentle reflection control. Perfect for luxury interiors, pool surroundings, and wall applications, these slabs combine comfort, strength, and timeless natural aesthetics.
filled-brushed.intro: Majen offers Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut parallel to the natural veins and carefully filled to enhance stability and durability. A subtle brushed texture highlights the natural vein movement while providing a soft, tactile surface with gentle reflection control. Perfect for luxury interiors, pool surroundings, and wall applications, these slabs combine comfort, strength, and timeless natural aesthetics.
filled-brushed.title2: What Is Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine?
filled-brushed.intro2: “Vein Cut” reveals the linear direction of the stone’s natural formation. When filled, the stone’s pores are sealed for strength and smoother maintenance; “Brushed” finishing then enhances surface texture with a gentle matte relief. This combination preserves the beauty of travertine veins while improving traction and tactile appeal. Majen’s controlled brushing process creates consistent texture across large areas, ideal for seamless architectural integration.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Brushed Finish on Vein Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: Brushing enhances the natural feel of travertine, creating a lightly textured surface that is slip-resistant yet smooth to the touch. Unlike polished finishes, it diffuses light softly, emphasizing the stone’s natural flow without glare. Filled pores maintain structural integrity and easy cleaning, making this finish ideal for both interior and exterior use. Majen’s advanced brushing lines ensure depth consistency and premium surface uniformity on every slab.
TextSection.text2: Use Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs for wall cladding, spa areas, pool decks, terraces, and interior feature walls. The balanced matte texture gives spaces a calm, organic character that complements wood, metal, and glass materials. Pair with polished or honed finishes for visual contrast or with matching tiles for seamless indoor–outdoor transitions. Majen supplies cut-to-size elements to ensure design and pattern continuity across all surfaces.
TextSection.text3: Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses, with large-format slabs available for high-end applications. Each slab is flattened and brushed under precision calibration to ensure even texture depth. Edges are square-cut and can be eased or chamfered upon request. Fabrication notes: install brushed surfaces following vein direction; seal lightly to preserve texture; avoid high-gloss sealants to maintain natural appearance.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen’s integrated quarry-to-export process ensures unmatched consistency. Blocks are hand-selected for color and vein clarity, filled and brushed under controlled conditions, and packed securely for worldwide shipment. We offer full FOB/CIF documentation, inspection reports, and moisture-protected crates. With years of experience supplying global designers and distributors, Majen guarantees durable, visually stunning, and easy-to-maintain travertine solutions.
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs globally with verified structural and visual quality. ivory.metaDesc: High-gloss luxury look with bright ivory tone.
ivory.h1: Ivory Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
ivory.title: Ivory Travertine Slabs
ivory.intro: Ivory Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs offer the perfect balance of natural character and soft elegance. The stone’s creamy beige tone and linear veining reflect the beauty of nature in a modern, tactile form. The filled surface ensures a smooth and durable structure, while the brushed finish enhances natural texture, creating a subtle, warm touch underfoot. Carefully sourced and processed by Majen, these slabs provide consistent tone, gentle movement, and long-lasting performance for both interior and exterior applications.
ivory.intro2: This finish is highly versatile for both indoor and outdoor design concepts. Indoors, it’s ideal for rustic-modern interiors, living room floors, feature walls, and staircases, bringing a sense of authenticity and coziness. Outdoors, the brushed texture ensures slip resistance, making it perfect for terraces, pool decks, courtyards, and garden walkways. The vein cut pattern creates graceful horizontal motion across large surfaces, complementing Mediterranean, coastal, and contemporary architectural styles with natural elegance.
ivory.text3: Ivory Filled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are available in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses. Average pricing ranges between USD 22–45 per m² for 2 cm and USD 32–55 per m² for 3 cm slabs, depending on tone selection and order size. Brushed finishes offer excellent durability with a naturally refined aesthetic, making them ideal for large-scale residential and commercial projects. Majen provides transparent quotations with breakdowns of quarry selection, processing, and logistics for precise cost planning.
ivory.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Polished • Vein Cut
ivory.text4: Filled: Resin-filled surface for structural strength and easy maintenance. Brushed: Achieved through mechanical brushing that softens the surface while emphasizing natural texture. Vein Cut: Linear vein orientation provides a sense of motion and depth, accentuating the stone’s organic flow. The combination of filling and brushing results in a warm, natural feel that’s pleasant to touch and suitable for various design aesthetics, from rustic to refined.
ivory.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Brushed vs Honed
ivory.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut reveals structured, flowing lines that emphasize order and harmony, while cross cut displays cloudy, irregular patterns with a softer look. Brushed vs Honed: Brushed travertine features tactile depth and visual warmth, while honed is smoother and more uniform. Brushed finishes are preferred for outdoor use or interiors seeking organic charm and natural resilience.

The filled structure ensures a continuous, easy‑to‑clean surface, while brushing reveals gentle texture that feels warm underfoot. Vein‑cut geometry introduces elegant linear movement across large areas. Selected from premium Turkish quarries and processed to strict tolerances, Majen supplies uniform tone, calibrated thickness, and export‑ready packaging for global projects.
light.intro2: These slabs suit residential and commercial environments that seek organic character without sacrificing practicality. Indoors, they elevate living rooms, lobbies, corridors, feature walls, and staircases with soft matte depth. Outdoors, the brushed texture offers added grip for terraces, pool decks, and garden pathways. The light palette enhances daylight and pairs beautifully with wood, metal, and neutral textiles. light.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Brushed • Vein Cut
light.text4: Filled: Surface pores are resin‑filled to create a smoother, less absorbent finish suitable for interiors and covered exteriors. Brushed: Mechanical brushing softens edges and highlights natural texture, delivering tactile comfort and slip assistance. Vein Cut: Parallel cutting to the bedding plane reveals graceful linear striations for directional design. Together, these treatments provide a durable, low‑glare surface with organic warmth and dependable performance.
light.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Brushed vs Honed
light.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut produces orderly lines and visual flow, ideal for corridors and large spaces; cross cut reveals cloudy, organic patterns. Brushed vs Honed: Brushed brings texture and grip with a natural matte character; honed is smoother and more uniform. Choose brushed for outdoor or rustic‑modern interiors; select honed when a sleeker minimal look is desired.

unfilled-brushed.h1: Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
unfilled-brushed.title: Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
unfilled-brushed.lead: Majen supplies Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Cut parallel to the stone’s natural layers, each slab showcases continuous linear veins while maintaining open pores for authentic texture. The brushed finish enhances surface tactility with a soft matte feel, adding warmth and slip resistance without sacrificing elegance. Ideal for calm interiors, terraces, and wellness areas, these slabs embody natural charm with refined craftsmanship.
unfilled-brushed.intro: Majen supplies Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Cut parallel to the stone’s natural layers, each slab showcases continuous linear veins while maintaining open pores for authentic texture. The brushed finish enhances surface tactility with a soft matte feel, adding warmth and slip resistance without sacrificing elegance. Ideal for calm interiors, terraces, and wellness areas, these slabs embody natural charm with refined craftsmanship.
unfilled-brushed.title2: What Is Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine?
unfilled-brushed.intro2: “Vein Cut” highlights the linear flow of the stone’s natural formation. “Unfilled” means the pores remain open, preserving the authentic travertine texture. The “Brushed” process softens the surface with controlled abrasion, creating a naturally aged, low-gloss look. This combination balances rustic character with subtle refinement, making it perfect for contemporary organic design.

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico

description: Natural linear veins, open pores, and soft-brushed texture for elegant tactile comfort. Durable, slip-resistant, and visually warm—crafted for authentic architecture.
Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico tones. Each tone brings unique charm while maintaining hue and vein continuity across surfaces.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Unfilled Brushed Finish on Vein Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: The unfilled brushed finish enhances natural texture while maintaining tactile comfort and grip. Open pores express the stone’s authenticity, and the brushed treatment creates gentle relief ideal for barefoot comfort. The matte surface reduces glare and diffuses light softly, making it perfect for bright, serene spaces. Majen’s precision brushing ensures even texture depth and controlled roughness across every slab.
TextSection.text2: Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are perfect for outdoor patios, pool decks, interior feature walls, and spa environments. Their natural grip makes them safe for wet zones, while the subtle linear veins add rhythm and direction to the design. Pair with honed or polished travertine for visual contrast, or combine with wood and metal for organic modern interiors. Majen provides cut-to-size coordination for seamless design flow throughout large-scale architectural projects.
TextSection.text3: Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm, with large-format slabs available for walls and floors. Each slab is brushed under controlled pressure to create consistent depth and tactile softness. Edges can be straight or eased according to design needs. Fabrication tips: use breathable sealers to maintain natural texture, align veins with visual direction, and avoid high-gloss coatings.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen operates as a quarry-direct supplier controlling extraction, cutting, and finishing from start to export. Each slab is inspected for structural soundness, color grouping, and consistent brushing depth. We provide FOB and CIF shipping options, detailed documentation, and secure wooden crate packaging. With global distribution and dependable logistics, Majen ensures professional service and consistent quality for every order.
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs worldwide to meet architectural and design requirements. Each shipment adheres to ISO standards for surface uniformity, roughness, and dimensional accuracy. For maintenance, clean with mild pH-neutral products and apply breathable sealers as needed. The open-pore surface naturally develops a patina, enhancing its timeless and authentic appeal over time.

filled-tumbled.h1: Filled Tumbled Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-tumbled.title: Filled Tumbled Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-tumbled.lead: Majen supplies Filled Tumbled Vein Cut Travertine Slabs from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut parallel to the stone’s bedding layers to reveal graceful linear veins. The natural cavities are filled for stability, then the surface is gently tumbled for an aged, time-worn look with soft edges and a velvety touch. Ideal for rustic villas, spas, and heritage-style interiors, these slabs combine durability, comfort underfoot, and authentic Mediterranean character.
filled-tumbled.intro: Majen supplies Filled Tumbled Vein Cut Travertine Slabs from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut parallel to the stone’s bedding layers to reveal graceful linear veins. The natural cavities are filled for stability, then the surface is gently tumbled for an aged, time-worn look with soft edges and a velvety touch. Ideal for rustic villas, spas, and heritage-style interiors, these slabs combine durability, comfort underfoot, and authentic Mediterranean character.
filled-tumbled.title2: What Is Filled Tumbled Vein Cut Travertine?
filled-tumbled.intro2: “Vein Cut” exposes continuous natural bands running through the stone. When pores are filled, surface integrity and ease of maintenance increase; the tumbling process then softens edges and textures, creating a warm, antique appearance. Majen uses special drum tumbling techniques to achieve gentle rounding without damaging the linear pattern. The result is a stone that feels handcrafted yet retains modern dimensional precision.

description: Quarry-direct slabs with natural linear veins, filled for stability and tumbled for warm, aged texture. Durable, anti-slip, and visually inviting for timeless interiors and outdoor spaces.
Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico tones. Each shade offers distinct personality while maintaining hue continuity and vein flow across large areas.
Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses. Large formats and rounded edges enhance comfort and reduce layout time.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Tumbled Finish on Vein Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: Tumbling creates a naturally weathered look with rounded corners and gentle surface relief. It reduces glare and provides pleasant grip underfoot, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor use. The filled structure prevents dust accumulation and makes cleaning easy. Majen’s controlled drum timing and abrasive mix ensure uniform texture depth and smooth edges while preserving the linear veining that defines Vein Cut Travertine.
TextSection.text2: Use Filled Tumbled Vein Cut Travertine Slabs for patios, pool decks, spa floors, fireplace surrounds, and heritage-style interiors. Their textured finish delivers grip and warmth underfoot while the linear pattern adds direction and visual rhythm. Combine with honed or brushed surfaces for contrasting zones or pair with antique metal and wood details for authentic character. Matching tiles and copings are available to achieve material continuity throughout the project.
TextSection.text3: Standard thicknesses are 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm, cut to maintain strength and dimension accuracy after tumbling. Large formats minimize joint lines and preserve the directional pattern. Edges are softened and corners rounded for safety and comfort. Fabrication tips: install with color-matched grout, apply penetrating sealer to ease cleaning, and avoid gloss coatings to retain the matte handcrafted appearance.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Filled Tumbled Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen oversees every step from block selection to final export. Our experienced technicians control filling, tumbling, and quality inspection under ISO-certified procedures. Each slab is reinforced for transport and accompanied by complete export documentation and certificates of origin. With consistent production and dedicated support, Majen is a trusted partner for designers, wholesalers, and project developers worldwide.
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Filled Tumbled Vein Cut Travertine Slabs to Europe, the Middle East, and North America. Every shipment meets international standards for surface roughness, thickness, and color uniformity. For care, use neutral cleaners, avoid acidic solutions, and reseal as needed to maintain stain resistance. The tumbled finish ages beautifully over time, developing a soft patina that enhances its authentic appeal.

ivory.intro2: This finish is ideal for spaces where heritage aesthetics meet modern durability. Indoors, it enhances hallways, fireplaces, and accent walls with soft, antique elegance. Outdoors, the tumbled texture provides grip and warmth for terraces, courtyards, and pool decks. The unfilled pores allow the stone to breathe, making it perfect for Mediterranean and coastal designs. Its aged surface, rounded edges, and natural veins evoke authenticity, creating spaces that feel inviting and enduringly beautiful.

ivory.text4: Unfilled: Natural pores remain open for authentic texture and breathability; sealing recommended for longevity. Tumbled: Softened edges and light surface wear provide an antique look with a naturally slip-resistant finish. Vein Cut: Parallel slicing accentuates linear veining, ideal for balanced, structured layouts. Together, these features create a tactile, timeless surface with versatile functionality indoors and outdoors.
ivory.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Tumbled vs Honed/Brushed
ivory.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut emphasizes structure and direction; cross cut offers soft clouds and natural irregularity. Tumbled vs Honed/Brushed: Tumbled adds antique character and edge softness; honed provides matte precision; brushed offers subtle texture. Choose tumbled for rustic or classic environments celebrating natural aging and warmth.

seo.description: Elegant cross-cut travertine slabs with soft, cloud-like movement. Filled or unfilled; honed, polished, brushed, or tumbled finishes. 2cm & 3cm, project-ready selection, direct quarry supply from Turkey.

cross-cut.title: Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
cross-cut.intro: Majen supplies Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab reveals elegant, cloud-like patterns formed when the stone is cut perpendicular to its natural veins. This cross-sectional view provides a calm, uniform aesthetic perfect for modern interiors, facades, and open spaces. With precision cutting, consistent tone control, and secure worldwide export, Majen ensures enduring beauty and performance.
cross-cut.intro2: Cross Cut Travertine is produced by slicing the stone perpendicular to its natural bedding layers, exposing circular and cloudy textures instead of linear veins. This technique creates a balanced, non-directional pattern ideal for spaces requiring visual calm and continuity. Each slab from Majen’s Uşak–Ulubey quarry undergoes meticulous selection and calibration to achieve uniform appearance and stability.

variants.title: Filled and Unfilled Surface Options
variants.text: Majen’s Cross Cut Travertine Slabs are available in both filled and unfilled versions to suit different project aesthetics. Filled slabs offer a dense and smooth surface, ideal for high-end interiors, while unfilled slabs showcase natural pores and depth. Both types undergo thorough quality checks, ensuring stable structures and flawless finishes before export. Each shipment is carefully documented with certificates of origin and reinforced wooden crate packaging.

cross-cut.desc: Cross Cut Travertine Slabs expose the stone’s soft cloud-like patterns, resulting in a balanced and consistent appearance. Perfect for calm, modern interiors and uniform facade applications.

TextSection.text1: Choose from polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled finishes to highlight the stone’s soft cloud-like structure. Polished slabs reflect light, enhancing elegant interiors, while honed or brushed surfaces create subtle sophistication. Tumbled options offer a naturally aged feel, perfect for outdoor or rustic projects. Majen ensures each surface is uniformly finished, combining beauty with practical performance.
TextSection.header2: Advantages of Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
TextSection.text2: Cross Cut Travertine stands out for its serene visual harmony and balanced pattern distribution. It’s ideal for open areas, hotel lobbies, kitchens, and large wall applications where seamless visual consistency is essential. The lack of directional flow allows flexible layout design and minimal waste during installation. Majen’s selection process guarantees uniform tone and high surface integrity for long-lasting results.
TextSection.text3: Cross Cut Travertine Slabs are widely used in flooring, wall cladding, bathrooms, and exterior facades. Their subtle patterning complements both modern minimalism and classical design concepts. Designers choose Cross Cut slabs for continuity, balance, and softness — transforming natural stone into a universal architectural element. Matching tiles and slabs ensure harmony across different surfaces.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Cross Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen operates as a direct quarry exporter, managing the entire production cycle from block selection to packaging. Every Cross Cut slab is inspected for pattern clarity, density, and calibration precision. With FOB/CIF shipping terms and international documentation, Majen provides a transparent and reliable export experience. Our reputation among architects and importers is built on consistent quality and sustainable quarry practices.
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Cross Cut Travertine Slabs to Europe, the Middle East, and North America. All slabs meet ISO standards for surface quality, color uniformity, and compressive strength. With reinforced logistics and secure crate systems, Majen guarantees safe transport and fast delivery times for wholesale partners worldwide.

description: Sourced from Majen’s Uşak–Ulubey quarry, these Cross Cut Travertine Slabs feature soft, cloudy movements with consistent color tones. Carefully selected and reinforced for export, they provide seamless installation and architectural balance for luxury projects.

Used in wall cladding, floors, bathrooms, and reception areas where soft patterns enhance interior calmness.The non-directional texture ensures easy layout matching and aesthetic uniformity across surfaces.
Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm, with tight calibration and precision cutting. Large panels enable quick installation and consistent pattern flow — ideal for hotels, villas, and offices.
Available finishes: polished, honed, brushed, tumbled in filled/unfilled options. Every slab is strapped, wrapped, and packed in reinforced wooden crates for safe international shipping.

ivory.intro2: This finish is ideal for interiors and exteriors that blend natural beauty with modern practicality. Indoors, it creates serene flooring, feature walls, and staircases with organic depth. Outdoors, the natural texture offers grip and rustic elegance for courtyards, patios, and covered walkways. The filled surface makes cleaning easier while maintaining the authenticity of the raw texture. Ivory Natural Cross Cut Travertine fits minimalist, Mediterranean, and contemporary design languages that value earthy elegance.
ivory.text3: Ivory Filled Natural Cross Cut Travertine Slabs are available in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses. Pricing typically ranges from USD 22–46 per m² (2 cm) to USD 32–56 per m² (3 cm), depending on tone uniformity, finish quality, and order quantity. Filling enhances resilience and hygiene, while the natural face provides authenticity and grip. Majen’s transparent pricing model outlines all cost components—quarry, finishing, and logistics—for global supply reliability and precision budgeting.
ivory.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Natural Face • Cross Cut
ivory.text4: Filled: Cavities sealed with resin to create a strong, durable surface suitable for various environments. Natural Face: Maintains subtle roughness and raw tactility, ideal for natural aesthetics and visual texture. Cross Cut: Slicing perpendicular to bedding reveals cloudy, non-directional patterns for organic visual movement. Together, these features balance durability and authenticity, offering a natural yet refined appearance for timeless design.
ivory.h5: Cross Cut vs Vein Cut • Natural vs Honed/Brushed
ivory.text5: Cross Cut vs Vein Cut: Cross cut creates cloud-like patterns that emphasize calm, organic flow; vein cut highlights structured linearity. Natural vs Honed/Brushed: Natural retains tactile roughness and minimal shine; honed is matte and smooth; brushed adds slight texture. Choose natural for authentic rustic charm with soft, natural light diffusion.

unfilled-natural.h1: Unfilled Natural Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
unfilled-natural.title: Unfilled Brushed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
unfilled-natural.lead: Majen supplies Unfilled Natural Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut perpendicular to the natural bedding layers, revealing elegant, cloud-like patterns across the surface. The unfilled natural texture preserves open pores, maintaining authentic breathability and tactile warmth. Perfect for rustic and organic interiors, facades, and garden designs, these slabs express timeless natural beauty and geological character.
unfilled-natural.intro: Majen supplies Unfilled Natural Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut perpendicular to the natural bedding layers, revealing elegant, cloud-like patterns across the surface. The unfilled natural texture preserves open pores, maintaining authentic breathability and tactile warmth. Perfect for rustic and organic interiors, facades, and garden designs, these slabs express timeless natural beauty and geological character.
unfilled-natural.title2: What Is Unfilled Natural Cross Cut Travertine?
unfilled-natural.intro2: “Cross Cut” highlights soft, cloudy patterns by slicing the stone across its natural formation layers. “Unfilled” means the pores remain open, showcasing travertine’s true texture and natural airflow. This finish retains the stone’s raw authenticity while offering natural slip resistance and visual depth. Majen carefully selects each slab for balanced color tone, surface stability, and organic pattern uniformity.

detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Unfilled Natural Cross Cut?

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico
variants.text: Majen offers Ivory, Light, and Antico colors to complement a wide range of architectural concepts. Ivory provides soft cream brightness, ideal for calm and airy spaces. Light offers warm beige neutrality for contemporary projects, while Antico introduces rich, earthy tones for rustic designs. All colors are sourced from the same quarry bench, ensuring hue consistency and harmonious patterns across slabs and tiles.

description: Quarry-direct slabs with open natural pores and soft cloud-like patterns. Breathable, durable, and perfect for rustic or modern organic spaces.
Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico tones. Each color provides balanced warmth and native movement across surfaces.
Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm. Large formats offer seamless pattern flow and ease of installation.
Primary finish: Natural Unfilled. Packed in reinforced wooden crates with moisture protection for global export.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Unfilled Natural Finish on Cross Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: Leaving travertine unfilled maintains its organic texture and authentic geological look. The unfilled natural surface is breathable, slip-resistant, and visually soft, making it ideal for both indoor and outdoor use. Its natural pores create texture depth while maintaining comfort underfoot. Majen’s precision calibration ensures dimensional accuracy without altering the raw surface appeal of the stone.
TextSection.text2: Unfilled Natural Cross Cut Travertine Slabs are perfect for terraces, pool decks, exterior walls, and spa zones. Their open-pore surface provides traction and natural ventilation, ideal for humid or warm climates. Use in combination with honed or brushed finishes to achieve contrasting textures within a unified palette. Architects often pair them with natural wood and glass to create timeless, biophilic design environments.
TextSection.text3: Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses, with large-format slabs for modern applications. Edges can be left natural, eased, or straight-cut depending on design intent. All slabs are calibrated for consistent thickness while preserving natural pores. Fabrication tips: use breathable sealers for longevity, avoid resin coatings, and maintain directional consistency for visual flow.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Unfilled Natural Cross Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen’s quarry-direct supply ensures authentic natural material with consistent quality control. Each slab is selected and graded for color stability, texture integrity, and pattern clarity. We offer FOB/CIF shipments with reinforced crates, certificates of origin, and detailed export documentation. With global experience and sustainable sourcing practices, Majen delivers reliability and natural stone excellence to every project.
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Unfilled Natural Cross Cut Travertine Slabs globally, meeting ISO standards for surface quality, flatness, and thickness. Routine cleaning with mild, neutral pH products maintains natural color and prevents buildup. Occasional sealing helps control dust absorption without altering texture. Over time, the stone develops a rich patina, enhancing its authentic aesthetic and timeless appeal.

filled-honed.h1: Filled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-honed.title: Filled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-honed.lead: Majen supplies Filled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut perpendicular to the natural bedding layers, revealing calm, cloud-like patterns instead of directional veins. The pores are filled to ensure density and easy maintenance, while the honed finish creates a smooth, matte surface with timeless elegance. Ideal for modern interiors, hotels, and architectural spaces that require visual balance and refined natural tone.
filled-honed.intro: Majen supplies Filled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut perpendicular to the natural bedding layers, revealing calm, cloud-like patterns instead of directional veins. The pores are filled to ensure density and easy maintenance, while the honed finish creates a smooth, matte surface with timeless elegance. Ideal for modern interiors, hotels, and architectural spaces that require visual balance and refined natural tone.
filled-honed.title2: What Is Filled Honed Cross Cut Travertine?
filled-honed.intro2: “Cross Cut” means the stone is sliced across its natural layers, producing soft, wavy textures instead of linear veins. When the stone is filled, natural cavities are sealed for a uniform, solid structure. The honed finish then refines the surface to a satin-like matte, eliminating reflection while highlighting the travertine’s natural warmth. Together, they create a smooth, elegant surface suitable for minimal, balanced designs and contemporary interiors.

light.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Honed • Cross Cut
light.text4: Filled: Resin filling closes pores for a smooth, sealed surface ideal for interiors and wet zones. filled-polished.h1: Filled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-polished.title: Filled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-polished.lead: Majen supplies Filled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut perpendicular to the natural bedding layers, exposing soft, cloud-like patterns instead of directional veins. The pores are filled for stability and easy maintenance, then polished to achieve a mirror-like surface with rich color depth. Ideal for luxury interiors, lobbies, and architectural spaces where refined texture and natural brilliance combine in perfect harmony.
filled-polished.intro: Majen supplies Filled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut perpendicular to the natural bedding layers, exposing soft, cloud-like patterns instead of directional veins. The pores are filled for stability and easy maintenance, then polished to achieve a mirror-like surface with rich color depth. Ideal for luxury interiors, lobbies, and architectural spaces where refined texture and natural brilliance combine in perfect harmony.
filled-polished.title2: What Is Filled Polished Cross Cut Travertine?
filled-polished.intro2: “Cross Cut” refers to cutting the stone across its natural formation lines, producing a non-directional pattern of soft clouds. “Filled” means natural pores are closed for durability and smoothness, while “Polished” enhances visual depth and luminosity. This combination results in a solid, elegant surface with exceptional reflection and fine texture. Majen’s precision filling and polishing ensure consistent tone, gloss level, and high-end finish across all slabs.

ivory.metaDesc: High-gloss luxury look with bright ivory tone.
ivory.h1: Ivory Unfilled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
ivory.title: Ivory Unfilled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
ivory.intro: Ivory Unfilled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Slabs blend mirror-grade brilliance with the raw character of natural stone. Soft cream-beige tones and cloud-like patterns create calm continuity, while the unfilled surface preserves open pores for depth and authenticity. Multi-stage diamond polishing elevates color and reflection, delivering statement luxury for premium interiors. Majen selects and calibrates each slab for tone harmony, flatness, and export-grade protection across global architectural projects.
ivory.intro2: Designed for sophisticated interiors where light and texture define the atmosphere. In hotels, galleries, and luxury residences, the polished sheen enlarges perceived volume and enhances tonal depth. The unfilled surface introduces subtle shadow play on feature walls and staircases, balancing glamour with natural character. Cross cut geometry disperses movement evenly, creating serene backdrops in lobbies, corridors, and bathrooms. For covered exteriors, proper sealing preserves long-term brilliance.
ivory.text3: Available in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses. Typical pricing: USD 26–58 per m² (2 cm) and USD 36–68 per m² (3 cm), varying by tone selection, polish grade, and volume. Polishing introduces additional finishing passes beyond honed surfaces, increasing cost while delivering superior clarity. Majen provides itemized quotations separating material, finishing, and logistics for transparent budgets and reliable procurement at scale.
ivory.h4: Technical Features: Unfilled • Polished • Cross Cut
ivory.text4: Unfilled: Natural pores remain open, enhancing authentic texture—specify penetrating sealer by application. Polished: Multi-stage diamond polish produces high gloss, maximizing depth and light response. Cross Cut: Cutting perpendicular to bedding reveals cloudy, non-directional patterns for calm continuity. Together, these features yield a luxurious surface that balances sparkle with organic integrity.
ivory.h5: Cross Cut vs Vein Cut • Unfilled vs Filled
ivory.text5: Cross Cut vs Vein Cut: Cross cut offers gentle, cloud-like motion; vein cut presents linear structure. Choose based on desired directionality and visual rhythm. Unfilled vs Filled: Unfilled showcases raw texture and shadow; filled delivers a smoother, easier-to-clean surface. Opt for unfilled + polished when dramatic light play and authentic material expression are priorities.

seo.description: Explore Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs with matte texture and soft cloud patterns. Ivory, Light, and Antico tones available for worldwide export.

filled-brushed.h1: Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-brushed.title: Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-brushed.lead: Majen supplies Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut perpendicular to the natural bedding layers, revealing calm, cloud-like formations. The pores are filled for stability and easy maintenance, while the brushed finish adds a natural texture with a soft matte touch. Perfect for contemporary and rustic interiors, these slabs combine strength, comfort, and timeless aesthetic harmony.
filled-brushed.intro: Majen supplies Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut perpendicular to the natural bedding layers, revealing calm, cloud-like formations. The pores are filled for stability and easy maintenance, while the brushed finish adds a natural texture with a soft matte touch. Perfect for contemporary and rustic interiors, these slabs combine strength, comfort, and timeless aesthetic harmony.
filled-brushed.title2: What Is Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine?
filled-brushed.intro2: “Cross Cut” travertine is cut across the natural formation layers, exposing soft, cloudy textures rather than linear veins. “Filled” slabs have pores sealed for stability and easy cleaning, while “Brushed” finishing enhances natural texture and depth. This combination produces a durable, tactile surface with natural warmth and subtle reflection control, ideal for both modern and traditional settings.

detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Filled Brushed Cross Cut?

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico
variants.text: Majen offers Ivory, Light, and Antico tones for Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs. Ivory provides soft cream radiance, perfect for bright interiors. Light offers neutral beige balance for contemporary spaces. Antico delivers a deep, earthy richness ideal for classic or rustic designs. All colors are extracted from the same quarry layer to ensure color consistency and natural harmony across installations.

description: Quarry-direct slabs featuring calm cloud-like patterns, filled for strength and brushed for soft texture. Durable, refined, and comfortable underfoot.
Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico. Each tone brings its own character while maintaining visual harmony across surfaces.
Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm. Large-format slabs minimize grout lines for seamless, elegant layouts.
Primary finish: Brushed with filled pores. Slabs are moisture-protected and packed in reinforced wooden crates for secure worldwide delivery.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Filled Brushed Finish on Cross Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: The filled brushed finish enhances tactile depth while retaining durability and easy maintenance. The brushing process provides soft texture and visual warmth, creating a surface that’s slip-resistant yet smooth to the touch. Filling the pores ensures hygiene and structural stability for high-traffic interiors. Majen’s advanced brushing technology delivers uniform finish depth and a naturally balanced matte tone across each slab.
TextSection.text2: Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs are suitable for interior floors, wall cladding, spa areas, terraces, and outdoor lounges. Their matte texture and neutral tones create calm, inviting environments. Combine with polished surfaces in feature zones for refined contrast or with brushed tiles for seamless indoor–outdoor continuity. Majen offers customized cut-to-size components for full design integration across architectural elements.
TextSection.text3: Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm, with large-format slabs available for modern layouts. Each slab is machine-calibrated for thickness accuracy and surface uniformity. Edges can be straight-cut or eased upon request. Fabrication recommendations: use breathable sealers, align patterns consistently, and avoid high-gloss coatings to preserve the natural brushed texture.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen ensures full control over quarrying, processing, and finishing for unmatched consistency. Every block is carefully selected for tone and pattern uniformity before filling and brushing. We provide FOB/CIF shipping with detailed documentation, reinforced wooden crates, and export certifications. With reliable supply and international service standards, Majen delivers excellence in both quality and logistics.
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Filled Brushed Cross Cut Travertine Slabs to Europe, North America, and the Middle East. All slabs meet ISO-certified tolerances for thickness, surface texture, and tone uniformity. Routine cleaning with mild pH-neutral solutions keeps the stone fresh and vibrant. Occasional resealing preserves the matte finish and enhances long-term resistance to moisture and wear.

unfilled-tumbled.h1: Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
unfilled-tumbled.title: Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut Travertine Slabs
unfilled-tumbled.lead: Majen supplies Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut across the natural bedding layers to reveal soft, cloud-like patterns. The unfilled tumbled finish preserves open natural pores while softening edges and surface texture for an aged, handcrafted look. Perfect for rustic interiors, garden walkways, and outdoor terraces, combining natural breathability, comfort, and timeless character.
unfilled-tumbled.intro: Majen supplies Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut across the natural bedding layers to reveal soft, cloud-like patterns. The unfilled tumbled finish preserves open natural pores while softening edges and surface texture for an aged, handcrafted look. Perfect for rustic interiors, garden walkways, and outdoor terraces, combining natural breathability, comfort, and timeless character.
unfilled-tumbled.title2: What Is Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut Travertine?
unfilled-tumbled.intro2: “Cross Cut” exposes the gentle, circular movement of travertine’s natural structure. “Unfilled” means the pores are left open, maintaining raw authenticity and breathability. “Tumbled” adds a naturally worn texture, with softened edges and slight surface relief for antique appeal. The result is a stone surface that feels organic, slip-resistant, and visually warm—ideal for natural, artisanal designs.

detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut?

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico
variants.text: Majen offers Ivory, Light, and Antico color options to suit both modern and traditional aesthetics. Ivory provides creamy warmth for bright outdoor spaces, Light delivers balanced beige for calm environments, and Antico adds deeper, rustic tones. All shades are quarried from the same layer to ensure color harmony and cloud pattern continuity across large projects. These tones complement wood, metal, and stone finishes perfectly.

description: Quarry-direct slabs with natural open pores and aged texture. Soft edges, durable surfaces, and authentic Mediterranean warmth.
Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico tones. Each tone maintains pattern harmony and timeless elegance across installations.
Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm. Large-format slabs enhance visual flow and ease of installation.
Primary finish: Tumbled with unfilled structure. Packed in reinforced wooden crates with moisture protection for secure global delivery.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Unfilled Tumbled Finish on Cross Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: The unfilled tumbled surface combines authentic natural texture with handcrafted aesthetics. Open pores allow breathability, while tumbling creates rounded edges and soft, comfortable touch. This finish provides natural traction, low glare, and a timeworn look that enhances with age. Majen’s precise tumbling process ensures uniform texture depth, gentle edge rounding, and high structural integrity.
TextSection.text2: Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut Travertine Slabs are perfect for terraces, pool areas, spa floors, and garden pathways. Their antique look and tactile surface make them ideal for both indoor and outdoor rustic designs. Architects often pair them with brushed or honed surfaces to balance texture and refinement. Use alongside wood or natural metal for an authentic Mediterranean aesthetic that stands the test of time.
TextSection.text3: Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses. Each slab is tumbled after precision cutting to achieve smooth, rounded edges and comfortable grip. Large-format options reduce visible joints and maintain natural pattern flow. Fabrication tip: use breathable sealers, avoid glossy coatings, and align cloudy patterns for visual harmony.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen oversees quarrying, cutting, and tumbling with strict quality control for consistent results. Each slab is inspected for tone balance, pattern clarity, and surface durability. We provide FOB/CIF export with reinforced wooden crates, moisture barriers, and certified documentation. With global logistics experience and reliable supply, Majen ensures elegant, long-lasting stone for every project.
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Unfilled Tumbled Cross Cut Travertine Slabs to Europe, the Middle East, and North America. Every slab meets ISO standards for texture depth, flatness, and color consistency. Routine cleaning with neutral products and occasional sealing maintains the stone’s vibrancy and tactile feel. The tumbled surface matures beautifully, developing a soft patina that enhances its natural charm over time.

description: High durability, quarry-direct sourcing from Uşak–Ulubey, and precise cutting deliver consistent A-grade travertine slabs. Reliable lead times and reinforced packing make Majen a trusted partner for global projects.

Travertine slabs are used for countertops, wall cladding, interior floors and exterior façades in residential, hospitality and commercial developments. Blaundos Antiko, Light and Ivory offer distinct tones for different design intents.
Standard production in 2 cm, 3 cm and 5 cm thickness. Common sizes include large formats suitable for efficient fabrication, reducing waste and ensuring predictable results at scale.

variants.heading: Travertine Slab Varieties
variants.text: Majen offers three main types of Wholesale Travertine Slabs From Turkey: Blaundos Antiko, Blaundos Light and Blaundos Ivory. Each selection is cut from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry for consistent texture, durability and natural elegance, and is export-ready with reinforced packaging for secure international shipments.

TextSection.text1: Majen ensures a seamless export process for travertine slabs, from precise quarry cutting to international delivery. Each slab is inspected, reinforced, and documented with commercial invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin. With FOB and CIF shipping terms, buyers worldwide can rely on a transparent, efficient, and secure supply chain for their travertine slab orders.
TextSection.text2: Every travertine slab is carefully graded to meet international standards. Factors such as thickness accuracy, surface finish, and color consistency are checked before shipment. Majen’s strict quality control guarantees that only A-grade travertine slabs are exported, reducing waste during installation and ensuring predictable results for projects of all scales.
TextSection.text3: Travertine slabs are in high demand across markets in Europe, the USA, and the Middle East. These slabs are widely used for countertops, wall cladding, flooring, and exterior façades in residential, commercial, and hospitality projects. Majen’s consistent slab supply makes us a preferred partner for importers, wholesalers, and construction firms worldwide.

With reinforced packaging, reliable documentation, and long-term relationships, Majen is trusted by global buyers of travertine slabs.

seo.description: Premium Blaundos Antico travertine slabs from Turkey. Quarry-direct, A-grade, export-ready. Finishes, sizes, and global delivery by Majen.

antiko.title: Wholesale Travertine Slabs Blaundos Antico
antiko.intro: Blaundos Antico travertine is a warm, beige-toned stone with antique character and subtle movement that suits both classic and contemporary designs. Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey region, Majen supplies wholesale slabs with consistent grading, reliable lead times, and reinforced packaging for export. Architects, importers, and contractors choose this variety for durable floors, façades, countertops, and bespoke interior features, achieving timeless elegance with dependable performance across residential and commercial projects.
antiko.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Antiko travertine slabs from Turkey
antiko.title2: Why Choose Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs?
antiko.intro2: Blaundos Antico stands out for its earthy palette, nuanced veining, and antique texture that adds depth without overpowering a space. Its density and calibrated finishes support heavy-traffic areas while remaining easy to maintain. With quarry-direct sourcing, Majen controls selection and grading, ensuring predictable results at scale. Competitive pricing, flexible MOQs, and project-matched lots help streamline specifications. For large orders, we provide sample boards and detailed QC reports, enabling confident decisions for global builds.
description: Why choose Blaundos Antiko slabs: antique-inspired look, expressive veining, bookmatch options and strong continuity on large surfaces. Excellent balance of authenticity and durability for premium interiors.

Sourced and processed in Uşak–Ulubey. Used in island countertops, bathroom vanities, reception desks, wall cladding, elevator surrounds and luxury retail fixtures. Shade-verified lots for consistent project outcomes.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs
ApplicationSection.text: Blaundos Antico is specified for floors, wall cladding, countertops, fireplace surrounds, stair treads, and exterior façades. Its antique texture lends character to boutique hotels and residences, while honed or polished finishes suit refined interiors. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled slabs complement landscaping, garden paths, and pool decks. The stone’s tonal stability supports continuity between inside and outside, helping designers create cohesive transitions. With accurate sizing and reliable supply, it scales from small renovations to flagship builds.
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, Blaundos Antico brings warmth to living areas and statement value to feature walls or reception desks. In kitchens and baths, sealed surfaces provide practical durability with natural beauty. Externally, its weathered look enriches patios and façades, aging gracefully over time. For public spaces, coordinated formats (slabs, tiles, custom pieces) keep design language consistent. Majen’s technical support advises on finish selection, slip ratings, and maintenance to match climate, footfall, and performance requirements.

AvailableSection.title: Available Sizes & Thickness
AvailableSection.text: Majen supplies slabs commonly at 2 cm and 3 cm thickness, cut from blocks selected for tone and structure. Custom dimensions can be produced on request, including book-matched sets for feature walls. Tight calibration and precision polishing ensure flatness and clean edges that speed installation. For special elements—vanities, stair treads, or oversized cladding—our team provides cut-to-size options that maintain vein continuity. Consistent sizing across batches supports predictable waste rates and accurate take-offs.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Slab thickness is controlled within industry tolerances to support even load distribution and dependable adhesion. Surface regularity reduces lippage risk on large floors, while square edges and stable geometry help installers achieve fine joints in visual-critical areas. For ventilated façades and lightweight assemblies, we coordinate with fabricators to meet bracket and anchor constraints. All dimensions are verified at dispatch, and reports are available for documentation and submittal packages when required.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Blaundos Antico can be supplied polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled to align with design intent and slip resistance needs. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

ExportSection.title: Travertine Slab Export Process
ExportSection.text: We coordinate the entire export cycle—from quarry selection and block cutting to finishing, inspection, and documentation. Orders include commercial invoice, packing list, and certificate of origin. With FOB and CIF terms available, our logistics team manages bookings, customs, and container optimization to protect material and timelines. Pre-shipment photos and QC summaries provide transparency. This streamlined process reduces administrative load for buyers and helps large projects maintain predictable schedules worldwide.

QualitySection.title: Quality Control & Grading of Slabs
QualitySection.text: Every Blaundos Antico slab is graded against criteria such as thickness accuracy, surface finish, color consistency, porosity, and structural soundness. We map natural features and exclude pieces that fall outside A-grade expectations for high-visibility applications. Moisture and adhesion checks support performance goals, while calibrated polishing ensures sheen uniformity. Clients can request detailed grading reports and photos to validate quality remotely. Only lots that meet specification proceed to packing and shipment.
QualitySection.subtitle: Inspection Criteria
QualitySection.subtext: Inspection verifies dimensions, flatness, edge quality, fill integrity, and finish continuity. Vein movement is evaluated for harmonious sequencing, especially for book-matched features. Any repairs are stabilized and re-finished to blend visually. Documentation captures measurements and observations so buyers can archive data for submittals and warranties. This disciplined process lowers on-site risk and supports consistent installation outcomes.

TextSection.text1: Explore complementary selections that pair well with Blaundos Antico. Each variety offers distinct tone and movement for different design intents, enabling cohesive palettes across floors, walls, and façades. Discover Blaundos Light Slabs for brighter schemes and Blaundos Ivory Slabs for creamy warmth. Coordinate with Travertine Tiles or Travertine Blocks to extend the language of natural stone through interiors, exteriors, and custom elements while keeping sourcing streamlined under one partner.
TextSection.text2: Ideal for kitchen islands, vanities and lobby walls. Pair with vein-cut bookmatch for dramatic continuity; specify 20–30 mm for interiors, 30+ mm for high-stress zones.
TextSection.text3: Reinforced A-frames, corner and moisture protection, photo-documented loading and shared seal numbers. FOB İzmir or CIF to major ports.

items.a: Its antique texture, warm beige tones, and subtle veining create sophisticated, timeless surfaces suited to both classic and modern designs.
Yes. Brushed or tumbled finishes with proper sealing are recommended for paths, pool decks, and façades.
Polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled. We guide finish choice by location, traffic, and maintenance needs.

items.a: In reinforced wooden bundles with interleaves, corner guards, strapping, and moisture-resistant wrapping.

Tiles are available in popular sizes such as 30×60, 60×60, and 40×80 cm, making them suitable for bathrooms, kitchens, patios, and pool areas. With finishes including polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled, our quarry-direct tiles are trusted by importers worldwide. Directly sourced from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry, these tiles are reinforced with consistent grading and inspected for international standards. Architects and wholesalers prefer Majen for reliable supply, transparent pricing, and diverse color selections. Whether for luxury hotels, villas, or residential projects, our travertine tiles deliver long-term performance and beauty.
description: High durability, precise cutting, and quarry-direct sourcing from Uşak–Ulubey make Majen a trusted supplier of Wholesale Travertine Tiles. Our tiles provide consistent sizing, A-grade quality, and secure packaging for reliable international supply.

Travertine tiles are ideal for bathrooms, kitchens, interior floors, patios, and pool decks. Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory offer distinct tones for residential, hospitality, and commercial projects worldwide.

Standard formats include 8″×8″, 12″×12″, 12″×24″, 16″×16″, 18″×18″, 24″×24″, 24″×48″, and 48″×110″, plus Versailles Set patterns. Typical thickness is 3/8″–3/4″. Precision cutting minimizes waste and ensures predictable installation for distributors, contractors, and large-scale developments.

Available finishes: polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled. For export, tiles are packed in reinforced wooden crates, strapped and wrapped to ensure safe container loading and long-distance sea freight.

variants.heading: Travertine Tile Varieties
variants.text: Majen offers three main types of Wholesale Travertine Tiles : Blaundos Antiko, Blaundos Light, and Blaundos Ivory. Each variety is cut and finished to highlight natural elegance and durability, then reinforced for secure sea freight—providing dependable material for importers and construction firms worldwide.

TextSection.text1: Majen ensures a smooth travertine tile export process, from quarry cutting to international delivery. Each tile is inspected, packaged, and documented with invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin. With FOB and CIF shipping terms, importers benefit from a transparent supply chain, reinforced packaging, and reliable delivery schedules for large-scale tile consignments.
TextSection.text2: Our strict quality control and grading of travertine tiles guarantees consistent thickness, accurate cutting, and surface excellence. Before shipping, each batch is checked for color uniformity and finish quality. Only A-grade tiles pass inspection, ensuring importers and wholesalers receive durable, reliable products that meet international standards for residential, commercial, and hospitality use.
TextSection.text3: Global markets and applications for travertine tiles include flooring, wall cladding, bathrooms, patios, and pool decks. Demand is strong in Europe, the USA, and the Middle East. Majen’s consistent production and export capacity make our tiles a preferred choice for distributors, architects, and contractors seeking versatile natural stone for both small and large-scale construction projects worldwide.
TextSection.header4: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Tiles?
TextSection.text4: Partnering with Majen for travertine tiles means working with an experienced quarry-direct exporter. From Uşak–Ulubey, we provide stable production, competitive pricing, and responsive customer service. Our reinforced packaging and complete documentation ensure safe global shipments. Long-term partnerships and reliable supply make Majen a trusted supplier for international buyers of natural stone tiles.
TextSection.subtext1: Average block size is 280×220×200 cm with natural surfaces. Export-ready, suitable for bulk orders, with reinforced packaging for container loading.
TextSection.subtext2: Countertops, wall cladding, flooring, and exterior façades where durability and natural elegance are required.
TextSection.subtext3: Polished, honed, tumbled, and brushed surfaces to match diverse design requirements and performance needs.
TextSection.subtext4: Custom designs elevate aesthetics and provide exclusive solutions while preserving travertine’s natural durability and texture.

seo.title: Vein Cut Travertine Tiles | Natural Stone Supplier – Majen
seo.description: Discover Majen’s vein cut travertine tiles – premium linear-pattern slabs for walls, floors, and facades. Sustainably sourced, precisely cut, and globally exported with unmatched quality.

vein-cut.title: Vein Cut Travertine Tiles
vein-cut.intro: Vein Cut Travertine Tiles by Majen showcase the timeless beauty of natural stone with continuous, elegant linear veins. Each slab is cut parallel to the bedding layers, creating a refined, directional pattern ideal for walls, floors, and facades. Preferred by architects and designers worldwide, Majen’s vein-cut travertine delivers unmatched visual harmony, durability, and sophistication for both modern and classical spaces.
vein-cut.intro2: Vein Cut Travertine is produced by slicing the stone in parallel with its natural bedding layers. This reveals continuous linear veins that emphasize structure, rhythm, and movement. The result is a refined stone that enhances architectural balance and visual depth. It’s an excellent choice for luxury interiors, high-end facades, and commercial spaces seeking a modern yet organic appearance.
vein-cut.desc: Large-size blocks selected at the quarry with consistent character.

TextSection.text1: Vein Cut Travertine Tiles are ideal for wall cladding, flooring, countertops, lobbies, and facades. Their directional flow enhances architectural symmetry and continuity. Designers value these slabs for creating expansive, harmonious spaces with natural elegance. Whether used in hotels, villas, or commercial projects, vein-cut travertine offers timeless appeal with the resilience required for both interior and exterior environments.
TextSection.text2: Majen’s vein-cut travertine tiles are available in a beautiful palette ranging from light beige and ivory to silver and gold tones. Each slab showcases unique vein patterns formed naturally over thousands of years, ensuring no two pieces are identical. These organic variations create a bespoke aesthetic appeal, allowing designers to achieve both consistent and dynamic looks depending on project requirements.
TextSection.text3: Proper maintenance ensures that vein-cut travertine remains as elegant as the day it was installed. Regular cleaning with a neutral pH cleaner and periodic resealing preserve its natural sheen and prevent staining. With proper care, Majen’s travertine tiles maintain their color integrity and surface strength for decades, making them a long-term investment for luxury architectural and interior applications.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen as Your Global Supplier?
TextSection.text4: Majen operates as a direct quarry supplier in Turkey, ensuring consistent quality, transparency, and export reliability. Every block is selected for vein clarity and color uniformity, calibrated for precise fabrication. With efficient FOB and CIF export services, reinforced packaging, and responsive customer care, Majen stands as a trusted partner for architects, distributors, and contractors worldwide.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq_span1: Vein-Cut
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_header: What makes vein-cut travertine different from cross-cut?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: Vein-cut travertine highlights linear, parallel veins, while cross-cut shows cloudy, irregular patterns. The vein-cut process emphasizes movement and flow, ideal for modern, symmetrical designs.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: Can vein-cut travertine be used outdoors?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Yes, with proper sealing. Majen’s brushed or tumbled finishes offer excellent slip resistance and weather durability, making them suitable for outdoor facades, patios, and pool areas.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: What are the available thickness options?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: Standard slab thicknesses are 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm. Custom thicknesses are available upon request for specific architectural or fabrication requirements.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_header: How do you maintain vein-cut travertine surfaces?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: Use a neutral pH cleaner and reseal periodically. Avoid acidic or abrasive products to preserve the stone’s natural luster and structure.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_text: Absolutely. Majen exports globally with FOB and CIF terms, ensuring reliable delivery through reinforced packaging and full export documentation.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq6_header: What is the best finish for high-traffic areas?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq6_text: Brushed or honed finishes are ideal for high-traffic areas, providing natural slip resistance while maintaining an elegant matte appearance.

variants.title: Surface Finishes and Design Options
variants.text: Majen’s vein-cut travertine is available in a wide range of surface finishes: honed, polished, brushed, tumbled, and natural. Each finish transforms the texture and feel of the stone to suit different design goals — from sleek, contemporary looks to rustic, aged aesthetics. Our slabs are produced with advanced calibration standards to ensure smooth surfaces, precise thickness, and consistent color tones for global projects.

description: Each travertine block is expertly cut using advanced machinery to ensure consistent thickness and precision. Majen’s tight calibration guarantees seamless installations with minimal material loss and superior structural integrity for every project.

Majen follows eco-conscious quarrying methods to minimize environmental impact. Responsible extraction, water recycling, and efficient logistics ensure sustainable stone production that aligns with international green building standards.

Choose from multiple surface treatments—honed, polished, brushed, tumbled, or natural—to achieve your desired look. Each option enhances the stone’s natural depth, adapting perfectly to both contemporary and classic design settings.

Majen’s logistics and packaging meet international export standards. Reinforced wooden crates, moisture protection, and accurate documentation (FOB/CIF) ensure your travertine tiles arrive safely, ready for global-scale projects.
